content.title: Land-Based Pollution
content.subtitle: Addressing threats to the ocean often begin on land.
content.intro: The land and the ocean are strongly connected by a series of human and natural processes, fueling ocean life cycles. Human activities on land have introduced higher levels of sediment and toxic chemicals into the ocean, threatening the health of the coast, ocean resources and billions of people.

info.content: Plant roots hold soil in place. Deforestation and forest degradation remove the roots and increase the risk of soil erosion.
Fertilizers and waste runoff can enable thick, toxic layers of algae — or algal blooms — to grow. This prevents sunlight from reaching the seafloor and causes the loss of ocean biodiversity.
Agriculture and livestock introduce nutrients to their environment. Excess nutrients can cause specific plants, like algae, to grow too fast.

widget.description: Proportion of sub-basins have a high or extremely high potential of driving coastal eutrophication
widget.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT ROUND((SUM(proportion)*100)) AS value FROM ocn_calcs_014_eutrophication_risk AS data INNER JOIN gadm36_0 gadm ON data.gid_0 = gadm.gid_0 WHERE gadm.{{geostore_env}} ILIKE '{{geostore_id}}' AND cep_label IN ('High (1 to 5)', 'Extremely High (>5)')

content.title: Ocean and Climate Change
content.subtitle: The ocean is central to regulating the global climate

widget.description: x% of current sub-basins have a high or extremely high potential of driving coastal eutrophication
widget.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT CONCAT(countries_w_measures, ' of ', total_countries) FROM (SELECT 'GLB' as gid_0, COUNT(DISTINCT(iso_code3)) AS countries_w_measures FROM ocn_025_rw0_ocean_ndc_measures WHERE value = 'Sectoral Measure Specified') measures INNER JOIN (SELECT 'GLB' as gid_0, COUNT(DISTINCT(iso_code3)) AS total_countries FROM ocn_025_rw0_ocean_ndc_measures) total ON total.gid_0 = measures.gid_0

info.content: Ocean acidification is caused by rising CO₂ levels in the atmosphere. Many critical ocean habitats and life forms begin to dissolve when the water is too acidic
Oxygen is a key requirement for ocean life. Climate change is warming the ocean and driving deoxygenation by limiting its ability to hold and circulate oxygen into the deep ocean

content.title: Ocean Biodiversity
content.subtitle: Biodiversity — the variety and variability of life on Earth — is the natural capital people depend on for survival.

widget.description: x% of current sub-basins have a high or extremely high potential of driving coastal eutrophication.
widget.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT ROUND(value) as value FROM ocn_024a_rw0_key_biodiversity_area_protection INNER JOIN ow_aliasing_countries AS alias ON alias.alias = geoareaname INNER JOIN gadm36_0 gadm ON alias.iso = gadm.gid_0 WHERE timeperiod = 2020 AND gadm.{{geostore_env}} ILIKE '{{geostore_id}}'

info.content: Lorem ipsum

In the ocean, biodiversity underpins marine ecosystem functioning, which provides valuable services for people, including food, protection from storm surges and rising sea levels, and carbon sequestration

content.title: Marine Protected Areas
content.subtitle: Marine protected areas (MPAs) defend key ocean habitats against threats, so the ocean can continue its pivotal role as a vibrant source of food and economic opportunity

info.content: MPAs that are fully protected can safeguard biodiversity, mitigate climate change and boost the productivity of fisheries in the surrounding areas

content.title: Ocean Dependence
content.subtitle: Humans rely on the ocean for sufficient, safe and nutritious food.

info.content: The ocean is a source of protein for x million people, supporting complete diets and access to food
Coastal ecosystems protect the coastline from  high waves during storms
From fishing through to pharmaceuticals, the ocean provides a source of income that in many cases cannot be replaced

content.title: Blue Economy
content.subtitle: The ocean is an engine of livelihoods, transport, commerce and energy production.

widget.description: x% of current sub-basins have a high or extremely high potential of driving coastal eutrophication.
widget.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=WITH r as (SELECT ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY total DESC) AS ranking, rw_country_code as country_code, rw_country_name as country_name, total/100. as value, year FROM ene_012_electricity_access_edit WHERE year = 2018 AND year IS NOT NULL AND total IS NOT NULL ORDER BY total DESC), v as (SELECT count(distinct(country_code)), 'BRA' as country_code  FROM ene_012_electricity_access_edit) SELECT * FROM r INNER JOIN v ON r.country_code = v.country_code WHERE r.country_code = 'BRA'

info.content: A sustainably managed fishery can feed the world, sustainable ocean management provides the means to support millions of  coastal communities

Tourism is an ever growing industry, often acting as a significant source of wealth for developing nations. Sustainable marine tourism provides essential jobs for a variety of communities and a means to engage with one of the worlds most important ecosystems
Ocean sources of renewable energy are projected to increase x fold over the next ten years. The ocean is a solution to unsustainable energy generation

country-profile.title: How is land based pollution generated?

content.comment: Renamed Water Quality Pressure Chart 1 Full-Size

content.text: Test text. Words words words, more words and words. Want to trigger a line break so will continue typing for a little while longer, but nothing fancy like special characters or line breaks.

content.comment: Test Chart 1: Population Exposed to Unhealthy Levels of PM2.5 (%)
Test Chart 2: Top 10 Protected Areas by Size

content.title: How is land based pollution generated?

content.text: Forests, grasslands and natural land covers hold soil in place with their roots. Soil erosion occurs when roots are removed by ecosystem degradation and deforestation.
Modified text for half-width item.

Modified text for full width item. Text needs to be long enough to incur multiple line breaks. Will the line break, and if it does, will that occur at the full width of the column, or two-thirds of the way across like in dashboards? Very suspenseful.
Test text element intended to take up one full "row".
Rivers, streams and groundwater contaminated with unwanted nutrients, pesticides and persistent organic pollutants can flow into coastal zones, introducing toxins that drive habitat degradation.

country-profile.title: How do pollutants travel to the ocean?

content.title: River Water Quality Modified Text Heading

content.text: When soil erosion from deforested and degraded land enters rivers and streams, it can flow into the ocean and create clouds of sediment which limit ocean photosynthesis.

options.sql: SELECT cartodb_id, the_geom_webmercator, st_intersects(the_geom, (select the_geom from gadm36_0 where {{geostore_env}} = '{{geostore_id}}')) as intersect, geostore_staging, geostore_prod FROM wat_068_rw0_watersheds_edit WHERE level = 3

indicators.title: OECD/FAO Agricultural Outlook 2020-2029
indicators.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT rank FROM (SELECT iso, value, RANK() OVER (ORDER BY value DESC) FROM (SELECT iso, ROUND(SUM(value)) AS value, RANK() OVER (PARTITION BY iso ORDER BY time DESC) AS yr_rank FROM  foo_063_rw0_nutrient_balance_edit WHERE indicator='Balance per hectare' GROUP BY iso, time) AS data WHERE yr_rank=1) AS ranked INNER JOIN gadm36_0 gadm ON ranked.iso = gadm.gid_0 WHERE gadm.{{geostore_env}} ILIKE '{{geostore_id}}'

widgets.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT SUM(value) AS value FROM foo_063_rw0_nutrient_balance_edit AS data INNER JOIN gadm36_0 gadm ON data.iso = gadm.gid_0 WHERE indicator='Balance per hectare' AND gadm.{{geostore_env}} ILIKE '{{geostore_id}}' GROUP BY time ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1

content.title: Land-Based Pollution
content.subtitle: Addressing threats to the ocean often begins on land
content.intro: The land and the ocean are strongly connected by a series of human and natural processes, fueling ocean life cycles. Human activities on land have introduced higher levels of sediment and toxic chemicals into the ocean, threatening the health of the coast, ocean resources and billions of people

info.content: Plant roots hold soil in place. Deforestation and forest degradation remove the roots and increase the risk of soil erosion.
Fertilizers and waste runoff can enable thick, toxic layers of algae — or algal blooms — to grow. This prevents sunlight from reaching the seafloor and causes the loss of ocean biodiversity.
Agriculture and livestock introduce nutrients to their environment. Excess nutrients can cause specific plants, like algae, to grow too fast.

content.title: Ocean Biodiversity
content.subtitle: Biodiversity — the variety and variability of life on Earth — is the natural capital people depend on for survival

widget.description: Average proportion of biodiversity hotspots within protected areas
widget.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT ROUND(value) AS value FROM ocn_024a_rw0_key_biodiversity_area_protection INNER JOIN ow_aliasing_countries AS alias ON alias.alias = geoareaname INNER JOIN gadm36_0 gadm ON alias.iso = gadm.gid_0 WHERE timeperiod = 2020 AND gadm.{{geostore_env}} ILIKE '{{geostore_id}}'

info.content: Biodiversity is threatened by overfishing, climate change, coastal development and pollution. Loss of biodiversity undermines the ocean’s natural capacity to provide essential ecosystem services and leaves the ocean less resilient to the effects of climate change

In the ocean, biodiversity underpins marine ecosystem functioning, which provides valuable services for people, including food, protection from storm surges and rising sea levels, and carbon sequestration

content.title: Marine Protected Areas
content.subtitle: Marine protected areas (MPAs) defend key ocean habitats against threats, so the ocean can continue its pivotal role as a vibrant source of food and economic opportunity

widget.description: Proportion of the marine environment that is currently protected

info.content: MPAs that are fully protected can safeguard biodiversity, mitigate climate change and boost the productivity of fisheries in the surrounding areas

content.title: Dependence on the Ocean
content.subtitle: Humans rely on the ocean for sufficient, safe and nutritious food

info.content: The ocean provides humans oxygen, deep cultural traditions, food and micronutrients. Human survival is intrinsically linked and dependent on this critical natural resource

Three billion people depend on resources from marine and coastal ecosystems as a source of protein and key nutrients. When ocean environments are put under stress, it puts coastal communities at risk of food insecurity

content.title: Blue Economy
content.subtitle: The ocean is an engine of livelihoods, transport, commerce and energy production

widget.description: Countries with the highest share of national CO₂ emissions from maritime bunker fuels
Proportion of total renewable energy that is currently generated by marine and offshore energy sources
widget.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT ROUND(SUM(CASE WHEN subtechnology IN ('Offshore Wind', 'Marine') THEN generation_gwh ELSE 0 END)/SUM(generation_gwh)*100) AS value FROM ene_009_renewable_generation_annually_edit INNER JOIN gadm36_0 gadm ON iso_a3 = gadm.gid_0 WHERE year=2018

widget.description: The hours spent fishing over the latest year globally. To explore the data in greater depth visit Global Fishing Watch, press the 'i' above.

info.content: The ocean is the source of millions of jobs in fishing, tourism, transportation, shipping and energy — and many more people are indirectly connected to the ocean economy
As the world looks to recover from the coronavirus pandemic and the economic fallout, the ocean can bring economic relief and economic prosperity
The ocean could provide a virtually limitless supply of clean, renewable energy — creating jobs and spurring economic growth

widgets.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT gid_0,CASE WHEN sum IS null THEN 0 ELSE sum END AS value FROM (SELECT gadm.gid_0, geostore_prod, SUM(proportion) AS sum  FROM(SELECT gid_0, proportion FROM ocn_calcs_014_eutrophication_risk  WHERE cep_label IN ('High (1 to 5)', 'Extremely High (>5)')) data RIGHT OUTER JOIN gadm36_0 gadm ON data.gid_0 = gadm.gid_0 GROUP BY gadm.gid_0, geostore_prod) sum WHERE {{geostore_env}} ILIKE '{{geostore_id}}'

widgets.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT ROUND(value) AS value FROM ocn_023_rw0_marine_protection_edit INNER JOIN gadm36_0 gadm ON iso = gadm.gid_0 WHERE year = 2021 AND gadm.{{geostore_env}} ILIKE '{{geostore_id}}'
widgets.text: of the country's marine area under national jurisdiction (including overseas territories) is currently protected

widgets.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT gid_0, SUM(value)/global_avg AS value FROM foo_061_rw0_blue_food_supply_edit country_data_v1 LEFT JOIN (SELECT AVG(protein_supply) AS global_avg, 'Ocean-Sourced Food' AS type FROM (SELECT area, SUM(value) as protein_supply FROM foo_061_rw0_blue_food_supply_edit WHERE element_code = 674 AND type = 'Ocean-Sourced Food' AND year = 2018 GROUP BY area) country_data_v2) global ON global.type = country_data_v1.type LEFT JOIN ow_aliasing_countries AS alias ON alias.alias = country_data_v1.area LEFT JOIN gadm36_0 gadm ON alias.iso = gadm.gid_0 WHERE element_code = 674 AND country_data_v1.type = 'Ocean-Sourced Food' AND year = 2018 AND {{geostore_env}} ILIKE '{{geostore_id}}' GROUP BY gid_0, global_avg
widgets.text: of the global average of marine protein consumption is consumed by the country's population

widgets.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT CASE WHEN value > 0 THEN CAST(ROUND(CAST(value AS NUMERIC),2) AS TEXT) WHEN value < 1 AND value > 0 THEN '<1' ELSE '0' END AS value FROM com_038_rw0_shipping_emissions_edit INNER JOIN gadm36_0 gadm ON gid_0 ILIKE iso WHERE datetime = CAST('2018-01-01' AS date) AND {{geostore_env}} ILIKE '{{geostore_id}}'
widgets.text: of the country's CO₂ emissions are currently generated by shipping

widgets.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT CASE WHEN ratio > 1 THEN CAST(ROUND(CAST(ratio AS numeric), 2) AS text)  WHEN ratio < 1 AND ratio > 0 THEN '<1' ELSE '0'  END AS value FROM (SELECT SUM(CASE WHEN subtechnology IN ('Offshore Wind', 'Marine') THEN generation_gwh ELSE 0 END)/SUM(generation_gwh)*100 AS ratio FROM ene_009_renewable_generation_annually_edit INNER JOIN gadm36_0 gadm ON iso_a3 = gadm.gid_0 WHERE year=2018 AND gadm.{{geostore_env}} ILIKE '{{geostore_id}}' GROUP BY iso_a3) data
widgets.text: of the country's renwable energy currently comes from the ocean

widgets.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT pol_type, gadm.gid_0, year, SUM(value::NUMERIC) AS value FROM ( SELECT *, CASE WHEN iso_ter1 IS NULL THEN iso_sov1 ELSE iso_ter1 END AS gid_0 FROM com_030d_fishing_effort_by_zone) AS data LEFT OUTER JOIN gadm36_0 AS gadm ON data.gid_0 = gadm.gid_0 WHERE pol_type = '200NM' AND year = 2020 AND gadm.{{geostore_env}}='{{geostore_id}}' GROUP BY pol_type, gadm.gid_0, year
widgets.text: spent fishing within the country's marine area under national jurisdiction over the latest year

country-profile.title: How is land based pollution generated?

content.title: How is land based pollution generated?

content.text: Forests, grasslands and natural land covers hold soil in place with their roots. Soil erosion occurs when roots are removed by ecosystem degradation and deforestation.
Poor wastewater management and the overuse of fertilizers and pesticides can introduce harmful pollutants into ocean ecosystems.

country-profile.title: How do pollutants travel to the ocean?

content.title: How do pollutants travel to the ocean?

content.text: When soil erosion from deforested and degraded land enters rivers and streams, it can flow into the ocean and create clouds of sediment that limit ocean photosynthesis.

content.comment: River Water Quality - Sediment Pressure map
River Water Quality - Sediment Pressure Chart

options.sql: SELECT cartodb_id, the_geom_webmercator, coast, st_intersects(the_geom, (select the_geom from gadm36_0 where {{geostore_env}} = '{{geostore_id}}')) as intersect, geostore_staging, geostore_prod FROM wat_068_rw0_watersheds_edit WHERE level = 5

country-profile.title: How does pollution damage coastal ecosystems?

content.title: How does pollution damage coastal ecosystems?

content.text: The ocean's ecosystems are deeply interconnected. Overlay the maps to discover management priorities and to better understand where ecosystem pressures and uses overlap.

country-profile.title: Why is the ocean so valuable?

content.title: Why is the ocean so valuable?

content.text: Millions of people and their livelihoods depend on the ocean and its coasts for valuable sources of food and employment.

indicators.title: Country rank: Ocean protein consumption/capita
indicators.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT CONCAT(rank, ' of ', max_rank) AS value FROM (SELECT gid_0, geostore_prod,rank, MAX(rank) OVER (PARTITION BY true) AS max_rank FROM (SELECT gid_0, geostore_prod,RANK() OVER(ORDER BY prop DESC) as rank FROM (SELECT area, SUM(CASE WHEN item = 'Ocean-Sourced Foods' THEN value ELSE 0 END)/NULLIF(SUM(CASE WHEN item = 'Grand Total' THEN value ELSE 0 END),0) prop FROM foo_061_rw1_blue_food_supply_edit WHERE year = 2018 GROUP BY area) data LEFT JOIN ow_aliasing_countries AS alias ON alias.alias = data.area LEFT JOIN gadm36_0 gadm ON alias.iso = gadm.gid_0 WHERE prop is not null AND coastal = true) ranked GROUP BY rank, geostore_prod, gid_0) max_rank WHERE {{geostore_env}} ILIKE '{{geostore_id}}'
indicators.description: Rank 1 = most protein consumed per capita out of the countries included

widgets.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT SUM(ocean_value)/NULLIF(SUM(total_value),0)*100 AS value FROM (SELECT area, year, item, CASE WHEN item = 'Ocean-Sourced Foods' THEN value ELSE 0 END ocean_value, CASE WHEN item = 'Grand Total' THEN value ELSE 0 END total_value FROM foo_061_rw1_blue_food_supply_edit WHERE year = 2018) data LEFT JOIN ow_aliasing_countries AS alias ON alias.alias = data.area LEFT JOIN gadm36_0 gadm ON alias.iso = gadm.gid_0 WHERE gadm.{{geostore_env}} ILIKE '{{geostore_id}}' GROUP by area
widgets.text: of the country's daily protein supply per person comes from the ocean, for the latest year on the chart

indicators.title: Country rank: Fish production/capita
indicators.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT CONCAT(rank, ' of ', max_rank) AS value FROM (SELECT *, MAX(rank) OVER (PARTITION BY true) AS max_rank FROM (SELECT *, RANK() OVER(ORDER BY value DESC) FROM (SELECT iso3_code, SUM(value)/pop*1000 as value FROM foo_062_rw0_fishery_production_edit production LEFT JOIN (SELECT yr_data AS pop, country_code FROM soc_076_country_population_edit WHERE year = 2020) population ON production.iso3_code = population.country_code WHERE measure = 'Q_tlw' AND type = 'GlobalProduction_quantity' AND production.year=2019 GROUP BY iso3_code, pop) data LEFT JOIN gadm36_0 gadm on gadm.gid_0 = data.iso3_code WHERE value is not null and coastal = true) ranked ) max_rank WHERE {{geostore_env}}='{{geostore_id}}'
indicators.description: Rank 1 = most fish produced per capita out of the countries included

widgets.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT SUM(value)/pop*1000 as value FROM foo_062_rw0_fishery_production_edit production LEFT JOIN (SELECT yr_data AS pop, country_code FROM soc_076_country_population_edit WHERE year = 2020) population ON production.iso3_code = population.country_code LEFT JOIN gadm36_0 gadm on gadm.gid_0 = production.iso3_code WHERE measure = 'Q_tlw' AND type ='GlobalProduction_quantity' AND production.year=2019 AND gadm.{{geostore_env}} ILIKE '{{geostore_id}}' GROUP BY gadm.gid_0, pop
widgets.text: of fish available for each person, produced by national fisheries and aquaculture in the latest year on the chart

indicators.title: Country rank: Women in fisheries
indicators.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT CONCAT(rank, ' of ', max_rank) AS value FROM (SELECT *, MAX(rank) OVER (PARTITION BY true) AS max_rank FROM(SELECT *, RANK() OVER(ORDER BY ratio DESC) as rank FROM (SELECT area, RANK() OVER(PARTITION BY area ORDER BY year DESC) as yr_rank, SUM(CASE WHEN sex = 'SEX_F' THEN obs_value ELSE 0 END)/NULLIF(SUM(CASE WHEN sex = 'SEX_T' THEN obs_value ELSE 0 END),0)*100 AS ratio FROM com_037_rw0_fishing_employment_edit WHERE type = 'Fishing' GROUP BY area, year) data LEFT JOIN gadm36_0 gadm on gadm.gid_0 = data.area WHERE yr_rank =1 AND coastal=true AND ratio IS NOT NULL) ranked ) max_rank WHERE {{geostore_env}} ILIKE '{{geostore_id}}'
indicators.description: Rank 1 = most women in the fisheries workforce out of the countries included

widgets.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT ROUND(female_employment/NULLIF(total_employment,0)*100) AS value FROM (SELECT area, year, SUM(CASE WHEN sex = 'SEX_F' THEN obs_value ELSE 0 END) female_employment, SUM(CASE WHEN sex = 'SEX_T' THEN obs_value ELSE 0 END) total_employment, RANK() OVER(PARTITION BY area ORDER BY year DESC) as yr_rank FROM com_037_rw0_fishing_employment_edit WHERE type = 'Fishing' GROUP BY area, year ) data LEFT JOIN gadm36_0 gadm on gadm.gid_0 = data.area WHERE yr_rank = 1 AND gadm.{{geostore_env}} ILIKE '{{geostore_id}}'
widgets.text: of the country's fisheries workforce were women, in the latest year on the chart

indicators.title: Country rank: Import/export ratio
indicators.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT CONCAT(rank, ' of ', max_rank) AS value FROM (SELECT *, MAX(rank) OVER (PARTITION BY true) AS max_rank FROM(SELECT area, RANK() OVER(ORDER BY ratio ASC) FROM(SELECT area,SUM(CASE WHEN element = 'Import Quantity' THEN value ELSE 0 END)/ NULLIF(SUM(CASE WHEN element ='Export Quantity' THEN value ELSE 0 END) ,0) ratio FROM foo_061_rw0_blue_food_supply_edit WHERE element in ('Import Quantity','Export Quantity') AND type = 'Ocean-Sourced Food' AND year = 2018 GROUP BY area ) data ) ranked LEFT JOIN (SELECT alias, iso FROM ow_aliasing_countries) alias ON alias.alias = ranked.area LEFT JOIN gadm36_0 gadm ON alias.iso = gadm.gid_0 WHERE coastal = true) max_rank WHERE {{geostore_env}} ILIKE '{{geostore_id}}'
indicators.description: Rank 1 = most reliant on imports of fish to meet in-coutry demand out of the countries included

widgets.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT ratio AS value FROM (SELECT SUM(CASE WHEN element = 'Import Quantity' THEN value ELSE 0 END)/NULLIF(SUM(CASE WHEN element ='Export Quantity' THEN value ELSE 0 END), 0) ratio FROM foo_061_rw0_blue_food_supply_edit LEFT JOIN ow_aliasing_countries AS alias ON alias.alias = area LEFT JOIN gadm36_0 gadm ON alias.iso = gadm.gid_0 WHERE element in ('Import Quantity','Export Quantity') AND type = 'Ocean-Sourced Food' AND year = 2018 AND gadm.{{geostore_env}} ILIKE '{{geostore_id}}' GROUP BY area) data
widgets.text: import/export ratio. A value >1 indicates a net importing country; a value <1 indicates a net exporting country

indicators.title: Country rank: Excess nutrient use/hectare
indicators.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT CONCAT(rank, ' of ', max_rank) AS value FROM (SELECT *, MAX(rank) OVER (PARTITION BY true) AS max_rank FROM (SELECT *, RANK() OVER (ORDER BY value DESC) FROM (SELECT iso, ROUND(SUM(value)) AS value, RANK() OVER (PARTITION BY iso ORDER BY time DESC) AS yr_rank FROM foo_063_rw0_nutrient_balance_edit WHERE indicator='Balance per hectare' GROUP BY iso, time) AS data WHERE yr_rank=1) AS ranked INNER JOIN gadm36_0 gadm ON ranked.iso = gadm.gid_0 WHERE value is NOT null and coastal = true ) max_rank WHERE {{geostore_env}} ILIKE '{{geostore_id}}'
indicators.description: Rank 1 = the most excess nutrients being used in agricultural soils out of the countries included

widgets.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT SUM(value) AS value FROM foo_063_rw0_nutrient_balance_edit AS data INNER JOIN gadm36_0 gadm ON data.iso = gadm.gid_0 WHERE indicator='Balance per hectare' AND gadm.{{geostore_env}} ILIKE '{{geostore_id}}' GROUP BY time ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1
widgets.text: of excess nutrients per hectare were put into the soil and nearby environment in the latest year

indicators.title: Country rank: Harmful fisheries subsidies
indicators.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT CONCAT(rank, ' of ', max_rank) AS value FROM (SELECT *, MAX(rank) OVER (PARTITION BY true) AS max_rank FROM(SELECT *,RANK() OVER(ORDER BY value DESC) AS rank FROM (SELECT country, SUM(constant_2018_usd) as value FROM ocn_022_rw0_fisheries_subsidies_edit WHERE category = 'Capacity-enhancing' GROUP BY country) data WHERE value is not null) ranked LEFT JOIN ow_aliasing_countries AS alias ON alias.alias = ranked.country LEFT JOIN gadm36_0 gadm ON alias.iso = gadm.gid_0 WHERE coastal = true ) max_rank WHERE {{geostore_env}} ILIKE '{{geostore_id}}'
indicators.description: Rank 1 = the highest expenditure on harmful subsidies out of the countries included

widgets.query: https://wri-rw.carto.com/api/v2/sql?q=SELECT CASE WHEN value > 1000000000 THEN CONCAT('$',SUBSTRING(CAST(ROUND(value) AS text), 0,4), 'B') WHEN value > 1000000 THEN CONCAT('$',SUBSTRING(CAST(ROUND(value) AS text), 0,4), 'M') ELSE CONCAT('$', CAST(ROUND(value) AS text)) END AS value FROM (SELECT country, SUM(constant_2018_usd) as value FROM ocn_022_rw0_fisheries_subsidies_edit WHERE category = 'Capacity-enhancing' GROUP BY country) data INNER JOIN ow_aliasing_countries AS alias ON alias.alias = data.country INNER JOIN gadm36_0 gadm ON alias.iso = gadm.gid_0  WHERE gadm.{{geostore_env}} ILIKE '{{geostore_id}}'
widgets.text: was spent on subsidies that negatively impact the health of the country's fishery

content.text: Coral reefs protect the shoreline from tropical storms and are a foundation for tourism, in turn providing coastal and inland communities with food and economic security.
Coral reefs and mangroves are essential aspects of strong food security in many countries. Both ecosystems support healthy fisheries by providing a habitat and nursery for juvenile fish.

Mangroves are five times more effective than land forests at storing carbon. These carbon storage powerhouses are crucial to climate adaptation and mitigation, but poor management and further mangrove degradation could release thousands of years worth of stored carbon dioxide.
